captions.text: I've travelled all around Europe but in fact I prefer Greece
We really like Thessaloniki as a city
We're coming frequently here for the last 20 years
It's the first time for me to visit a museum
I love the history, so much history in this city
We were in the Church of Saint Dimitrios yesterday incredible experience
All of this the monuments and all the history is terrific
In Pella we went to visit the Palace of Alexandro Magno
It's a wonderful place to sort of just come and relax and have a wonderful time
We like the food
The nightlife is great here
The people are so giving and so compassionate, so welcoming
The locals in general have been lovely, very friendly
Very friendly
Educated, well spoken
Everyone has been very friendly in the streets when we asked for directions and any ideas where to go, everyone has been very helpful
We found everybody to be very polite
I think that public transport is very good to get around the city or to the beaches
We love to swim so we do love the beaches
I felt very safe walking around, very safe on the buses, very safe with our bags
Yeah I will come back for sure
I don't want to leave

comments.text:
Well I actually I am :) I just started my second year and I can say my 
feelings didn't change about this city. Even after knowing the city better, 
even it's not so nice sides (like every city has it of course), I can say 
it remains a very relaxing and civilized city in my eyes. It's way better 
than my hometown (Bucharest). I like the way it's structured, the history 
that is revealed in it's urban view and the people. Even traffic is way 
better than in my city :)) So I can say it is beautiful :)
comments.author: The smoking duck

comments.text:
I was here, I'm coming to greece for 7 years and it's amazing. Trust me! 
It's the best country that you can visit, perfect people, perfect views and 
perfect atmosphere.

Romantic, Touristic, a lot of Student life. :)

comments.text:
well 2 weeks later, after my trip to Greece... and it appears someone used 
their Kamaki skills on me... I ended up staying 5 days in Athens with my 
Host... and he just booked his plane tickets to spend 5 days with me in 
Munich at the end of July. Currently looking into Universities in Athens or 
Thessaloniki... :D also bought my first Greek language book yesterday.

out with my Couchsurfing hosts. :) I'm from West Virginia, in the US. But I 
live in Munich Germany.

comments.text:
That made me cry! It's so true what they said. Not just Thessaloniki, but 
ALL of Greece. The people were really patient when we asked for directions, 
and even if they weren't from the area, they would help us, and were really 
patient. And we could just walk up to a random restaraunt and ask for 
directions, and they would help us, and I felt welcome everywhere I went, 
and the ppl in Thessaloniki market were so friendly, and happy to see me 
with my video camera! Amazing people! Amazing place!
comments.author: briantravelman

comments.text:

comments.text:
I'm a student at City College-International faculty of University of 
Sheffield and I'm coming on 18th of September in Thessaloniki to start my 
college life, the best years as it is said:p and I'm so excited about 
living in Thessaloniki. Greece is absolutely amazing...and I didn't even 
cared about what they say at TV in my country about Greece and the 
economical crisis. I know Greece will never fall...it can't fall...it is 
just to fucking awesome:) Respect from Romania! Forever and ever brothers
